title: I can’t forgive my partner for pushing me into having a termination
text:
A few months ago, I was browsing make-up in a department store. The woman next to me, buying a lipstick, had a baby strapped to her chest in a sling. When I saw her, I ran to the toilets and burst into tears. Had my own pregnancy gone to term, my baby would have been about the same age. But I’d had a termination, something that I bitterly regret – and blame my partner Alex* for.

We met at university and spent our 20s and early 30s building our careers, assuming we’d start a family later as we both wanted children. After my 35th birthday we started trying, but a year later we still hadn’t conceived. We were told it was unexplained infertility.

We looked into IVF but weren’t eligible on the NHS,...
